description: Construction of an additional fourth floor to establish 5 self-contained flats (3x1 bedroom and 2x2 bedroom) and external alterations to the established building
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 1539-PL03 (Ground Floor Plan), 1539-PL04 REV B (Fourth Floor Plan), 1539-PL05 (Roof Plan), 1539-PL06 (North and West Elevations), 1539-PL07 REV B (South and East Elevations), 1539-PL08 (East and West Courtyard Elevations), 1539-PL09 (Sections)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| The approved residential dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2)(Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan 2015; and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.
| Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
o	Details of construction hours;

o	A restriction that the footpath and carriageway within the Apex Court residential complex is not blocked during construction. No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
o	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;

i.	Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
o	Site security during construction;
o	Construction methods;
o	Site management and access;
o	Vehicle and machinery specifications;
o	Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries;
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents (including within Apex Court);

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development herby approved is commenced. The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the cycle parking and storage shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development herby approved prior to first occupation. The details of the cycle parking spaces and storage shall be fully implemented as approved prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the development provides an appropriate balance of transport options, reduce the likelihood of traffic congestion and does not adversely affect the safety of the road network, in accordance with policy 1.1 (f) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13. | The refuse storage shown on 15-020-P01 (Proposed OS Plan) shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse storage in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan 2015. | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan SO-631-02 REV D shall be formed prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | No part of the flat roof (not shown as balcony space) shall be used as or altered to form an additional balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan - consolidated (2015). | The proposed kitchen windows for flats 1.02, 1.03 and 1.04 on the southern elevations hereby approved shall contain only obscure glass (minimum level 3 obscure glazed) and be non-opening unless the parts of the windows can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the rooms in which the windows are installed.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan - consolidated (2015). | The proposed opaque glass screen on the southern elevation hereby approved as shown on drawing 1539-PL04 REV A (Fourth Floor Plan) shall be installed prior to occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan - consolidated (2015).
